name: Caitlin Maska
summary: Driven and compassionate health and wellness professional with eight years of experience. Accountable, organized, and responsible with a strong focus in health education, clinical nutrition and exercise physiology.

experience.title: Health Coach
experience.description: Provided health coaching to employees of multiple corporate clients (e.g., Procter & Gamble, The Hartford). Collaborated with participants using motivational interviewing and an evidence-based approach to develop a health goal and action plan geared towards behavior change.

experience.title: Clinical Nutritionist and Exercise Physiologist, Owner
experience.description: Promote awareness of current health and wellness research, news and content through social media. Provided nutritional consultation and exercise prescriptions to clients.

experience.title: Speaker/Health Educator
experience.description: Present health and wellness seminars. Perform biometric assessments (i.e., height, weight, BMI, body fat percentage) and review lab results (e.g., cholesterol and blood glucose).

experience.title: Health Educator
experience.description: Assisted participants in developing health goals and behavior change. Collaborated with a team of social workers, dietitians, pharmacists, and behavioral health specialists; made referrals as needed.

experience.title: Fitness Director
experience.description: Developed and coordinated fitness programs based on the needs of the population. Tracked participation and health assessment data to evaluate progress. Organized and executed timely and successful marketing campaigns for programs. Created marketing materials to promote programs (i.e., brochures, flyers, and postcards). Composed and edited monthly and quarterly newsletters.

experience.title: Health Project Coordinator in Exercise Physiology
experience.description: Coordinated the day-to-day operations of a research study (The effects of an aerobic and resistance training program on fatigue experienced by breast cancer patients undergoing radiation treatment). Managed operation of the PEAK (Physical Exercise and Kinesiology) Laboratory. Performed exercise testing on eligible patients that consented to study.

experience.title: Clinical Support Assistant
experience.description: Collaborated with a multidisciplinary team on a daily basis to help assist in the care of patients on the bone marrow transplant unit. Performed administrative duties including triaging phone calls, managing appointments and lab order entry.

education.degree: Master of Science, Applied Clinical Nutrition

education.school: State University of New York at Buffalo
State University of New York at Geneseo

certifications: American College of Sports Medicine Registered Clinical Exercise Physiologist
American College of Sports Medicine Certified Cancer Exercise Trainer
American College of Sports Medicine Certified Personal Trainer
